result.execSummary:
The defendant Lillian J Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

STAYED.
IF REVOKED:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIEDD. ALL COSTS PAID IN FULL
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with the officers involved.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Attend Anger Management course.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lillian J Richardson in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a no contest plea to count 1. Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 14 days)
  -  12 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  12 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Notify Agent of all/any prescribed medications
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random Drug testing ; 
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  the officers involved
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Attend Anger Management Course
  
FINE or COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 4 months, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Apply any bail that is posted.
Hearing at 03-14-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant to have no contact with the officer listed in the complaint unless its for emergency.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody. Defendant must post $1000.00 cash  in addition to the $1000.00 already posted.

Court adjourns the matter for the status of new appointment of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
